reviews.title: The best company I've worked for
reviews.pros: • A company that values it's employees with great benefits and events to keep employees engaged. • Embraces Diversity and Inclusion very well • The culture is excellent, not corporate, but very collaborative, colleagues are pleasant to work with. • Offices are lovely and free lunch and snacks are provided, as well as freebies (clothes, etc) • The company is financially stable and more resilient post pandemic • Good Career structure
reviews.cons: • In order to get the most out of your role, you need to be agile and adapt quickly to changes and embrace it, this may not suit everyone. • No company is perfect, but Tripadvisor is close

reviews.title: Exciting time at Trip
reviews.pros: Smart, passionate people New leadership team with fresh ideas Abundant L&D opportunities Amazing benefits especially for women Great balance and flexibility
reviews.cons: Tricky time to be in travel while we wait for the rebound
reviews.advice: Resource programming for remote employees Values need a reboot

reviews.title: good for short term
reviews.pros: flexible working hours. although lots of meeting, but if you want schedule you day work, it has very flexible working hours.
reviews.cons: 1.8 years to get RSU, and it seems that you have to be promoted to get RSU, otherwise you may have to leave within 1.5 years. I don't suggest anyone who looks for long term work. it is only suitable for short term.

reviews.title: Poor management. Favourtism obvious
reviews.pros: Travel Industry clients, range of agencies and brands to work on
reviews.cons: Managers not interested in helping with career progression Managers regularly cancelled 1-1 meetings Sales overworked (understaffed)
reviews.advice: Stop protecting the brand and focusing on CPC and increasing revenue from "clicks" and focus more on your employees and your product. The brand and site lost it's value due to "OVER Commercialisation". Doesn't feel authentic. Not easy to use.
